subject: Critical Thinking
title: Logic and Language: When Words Deceive
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Logic and Language: When Words Deceive.

hook.text: 'Nothing is better than happiness. A sandwich is better than nothing. Therefore a sandwich beats happiness.'

buildup.text: Natural language is ambiguous. 'Nothing' means different things in each premise. Logic exposes the trick.

discovery.text: Politicians exploit this constantly: vague words that seem logical but fall apart under formal analysis.

twist.text: Even 'and' and 'or' cause trouble. In law, 'or' is exclusive; in everyday speech, it's often inclusive.

climax.text: Translating natural language into logic reveals hidden ambiguity, assumptions, and fallacies.

punchline.text: Language persuades. Logic clarifies. You need both.

quiz.question: Why does the 'sandwich vs. happiness' argument fail?
options: The word 'nothing' changes meaning between premises
